original_title: Hackaday Podcast Episode 314: It’s Pi, but Also PCBs in Living Color and Ultrasonic Everything
original_content:
It might not be Pi Day anymore, but Elliot and Dan got together for the approximately 100*Pi-th episode of the Podcast to run through the weeks coolest hacks. Ultrasound seemed to be one of the themes, with a deep dive into finding bugs with sonar as well as using sound to cut the cheese  and cakes and pies, too.
The aesthetics of PCBs were much on our minds, too, from full-color graphics on demand to glow-in-the-dark silkscreens. Is automation really needed to embed fiber optics in concrete? Absolutely! How do you put plasma in a bottle? Apparently, with kombucha, Nichrome, and silicone. If you need to manage your M:TG cards, scribble on the walls, or build a mechanical chase light, weve got the details. And what exactly is a supercomputer? We cant define it, but we know one when we see it.

No news is good news!

Whats that Sound?

Congrats to [IrishBoss] for guessing the angle grinder.  And from Dan Maloney: It was the ear protection, I swear!

title: - 超音波技術を活用した最新の電子工作ハック
body: ElliotとDanが最新のハッキングを紹介するポッドキャスト。超音波や美しいPCBに焦点を当てた内容。
titles: - 超音波技術を活用した最新の電子工作ハック
